com.cubeia.firebase.api.service.clientregistry
Interface PublicClientRegistryService

All Superinterfaces:
Contract
public interface PublicClientRegistryService
extends Contract

Public accessor service for the distributed and local client registry. This interface exposes a subset of the internal client registry to game developers.

Author:
Fredrik

Method Summary

Method Detail

getScreenname

String getScreenname(int clientId)
Get a logged in players screenname.

Parameters:
playerId - Player ID
Returns:
the screen name or null if not logged in.

getPlayerData

Map<?,?> getPlayerData(int clientId)
Returns an immutable map of player data contained in the distributed player registry.

Parameters:
playerId - Player ID
Returns:
A map of string attributes, or null of not found

isLoggedIn

boolean isLoggedIn(int clientId)
Check if a player is logged in to the system.

Parameters:
playerId - Player ID
Returns:
true if logged in, false otherwise

getClientStatus

ClientSessionState getClientStatus(int clientId)
Get status for a client's session.

Parameters:
clientId - Player ID
Returns:
Session state, or null if not found

getSeatedTables

Map<Integer,Integer> getSeatedTables(int clientId)
Get all tables that a client is seated at. Should never return null.

Parameters:
playerId - Player ID
Returns:
Map of table ID mapped to seat ID, rturns empty map if not found

registerPlayerToTable

void registerPlayerToTable(int tableid,
                           int clientId,
                           int seat,
                           boolean remove)
Manage an association of a table:seat to a player. This method should be used if the player was manually seated. It is used both to add and remove associations

Parameters:
tableid - Table ID player was seated at
playerid - ID of the seated player
seat - Seat if the player was seated at
remove - True to remove the association, false to add

registerPlayerToTable

void registerPlayerToTable(int tableid,
                           int clientId,
                           int seat,
                           int mttId,
                           boolean remove)
Register an association of a table:seat to a player. This method should be used if the player was manually seated. It is used both to add and remove associations

Parameters:
tableid - Table ID player was seated at
playerid - ID of the seated player
seat - Seat if the player was seated at
mttId - Should be -1 if not a tournament table
remove - True to remove the association, false to add

registerWatcherToTable

void registerWatcherToTable(int tableid,
                            int clientId,
                            boolean remove)
Register an association of a watcher to a table. It is used both to add and remove associations

Parameters:
tableid - Table ID player is watching at
playerid - ID of the watching player
remove - True to remove the association, false to add

getRemoteAddress

SocketAddress getRemoteAddress(int clientId)

Get the remove address of the client.

Will return null if the client is not found. If you using a load balancer you might have to configure it to keep the original IP address of the remote client.

Parameters:
clientId - Player ID
Returns:
Remote socket address, or null if not found

getLocalClientCount

int getLocalClientCount()
Get the number of clients logged in on this server.

Returns:
number of clients.

getGlobalClientCount

int getGlobalClientCount()
Get the number of clients logged in to the system. This method as performance implications and it is recommended that it is not executed frequently.

Returns:
number of clients logged in to the system

getAllLoggedIn

int[] getAllLoggedIn()
Get a list of all clients logged in to the system (client ids).

isLocal

boolean isLocal(int clientId)
Returns true if the client with the given id is managed on this node locally. This applies both to live clients and clients waiting for reconnects.

Parameters:
clientID - Player ID
Returns:
True if logged in on this local node, false otherwise
